result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COMBINED BOND  22CF172, 22CF173, and 22CF152  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

records.addlTxt:
8:46 AM Defendant Jeremy Lee Shumate appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack not in court. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court indicates off the record discussion with DEF,  DEF wishes to proceed without attorney for initial appearance and set for preliminary hearing. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 4.  Court sets for preliminary hearing.   Attny may argue bond at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
